title: Bug 49195 - Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port='1' in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
OB:
When using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service, Tomcat prints the following error message in the catalina.20100427.log:
27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServerSEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.
However, despite this error message, Tomcat is actually stopped as Catalina.stopServer() performs System.exit(1) after printing the message. It is worth noting that when the service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalina.server is not null.
EB: When using 1 as the shutdown port with the Windows service, Tomcat should not print any error message in the logs. The server should shut down successfully without displaying any error message.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Specify <Server port='1' in the server.xml file.
2. Start the Tomcat Windows service.
3. Check the catalina.20100427.log file for any error messages related to the shutdown port configuration.
